instruction: Explain the basic rules of cricket.
output: Cricket is played between two teams of 11 players. One team bats to score runs while the other bowls and fields to restrict them.

instruction: What is an over in cricket?
output: An over is a set of six legal deliveries bowled by one bowler.

instruction: What is LBW in cricket?
output: LBW stands for Leg Before Wicket. A batsman can be given out LBW if the ball hits their leg in line with the stumps and would have hit the wicket.

instruction: What is a century in cricket?
output: A century is when a batsman scores 100 runs in a single innings.

instruction: Greet the user shortly.
output: Hi! I am your cricket assistant. Ask me anything about cricket.

instruction: Who is the wicket-keeper?
output: The wicket-keeper is a fielding player who stands behind the stumps to catch or stump the batsman.

instruction: What is the role of a bowler?
output: The bowler delivers the ball towards the batsman with the aim of dismissing them or preventing runs.

instruction: What is a no-ball?
output: A no-ball is an illegal delivery by the bowler, resulting in one extra run for the batting team and a free hit in some formats.

instruction: What is a powerplay in cricket?
output: A powerplay is a period during limited-overs cricket where fielding restrictions apply.

instruction: Who wins a cricket match?
output: The team that scores more runs than the opponent wins the match.

instruction: Who holds the record for the most centuries in International Cricket (Tests and ODIs combined)?
output: Sachin Tendulkar holds the record with 100 international centuries (51 in Tests and 49 in ODIs).

instruction: Which Indian bowler took the first hat-trick for India in a Test match?
output: Harbhajan Singh, achieving the feat against Australia in Kolkata in 2001.

instruction: Which Indian captain led the team to victory in the 1983 Cricket World Cup?
output: Kapil Dev was the captain of the 1983 World Cup-winning Indian team.

instruction: Who was the first Indian batsman to score a triple century in Test cricket?
output: Virender Sehwag, scoring 309 against Pakistan in Multan in 2004.

instruction: Which Indian player has the most appearances in IPL history?
output: MS Dhoni holds the record for the most matches played in the Indian Premier League (IPL).

instruction: What is Virat Kohli's highest individual score in Test cricket?
output: Virat Kohli's highest Test score is 254 not out, achieved against South Africa in Pune in 2019.

instruction: Who was the first Indian cricketer to score a century in T20 International cricket?
output: Suresh Raina, scoring 101 against South Africa in the 2010 T20 World Cup.

instruction: Which Indian cricketer is known by the nickname 'The Wall'?
output: Rahul Dravid, known for his solid technique and long innings, earned the nickname 'The Wall'.

instruction: Who holds the record for the fastest century by an Indian in Test cricket?
output: Kapil Dev, scoring a century off 74 balls against Sri Lanka in Kanpur in 1986.

instruction: What unique record does Anil Kumble hold regarding taking all ten wickets in a Test innings?
output: Anil Kumble is the only Indian and the second player overall to take all 10 wickets in a Test innings, achieving 10/74 against Pakistan in Delhi in 1999.

instruction: Which Indian bowler has the most wickets in IPL history?
output: Yuzvendra Chahal holds the record for the most wickets taken by an Indian bowler in the IPL.

instruction: Who was the first Indian to score a double century in Men's ODI cricket?
output: Sachin Tendulkar, scoring 200 not out against South Africa in Gwalior in 2010.

instruction: What is the name of the stadium where Sachin Tendulkar played his final Test match?
output: Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai, where he played his 200th Test against the West Indies in November 2013.

instruction: Which Indian player captained the team that won the 2007 ICC World T20?
output: MS Dhoni captained the side that won the inaugural ICC World T20 in South Africa.

instruction: Who is the highest run-scorer for India in Test cricket history?
output: Sachin Tendulkar holds the record with 15,921 runs.

instruction: What is the highest wicket-taker for India in ODI cricket?
output: Anil Kumble is the highest wicket-taker for India in ODIs with 337 wickets.

instruction: Which Indian batsman scored the fastest century in IPL history?
output: Yusuf Pathan (now retired), scoring a century off 37 balls for Rajasthan Royals against Mumbai Indians in 2010.

instruction: Which Indian player holds the record for the most number of 'Man of the Match' awards in Test cricket?
output: Sachin Tendulkar holds the record for the most 'Man of the Match' awards for India in Test cricket.

instruction: What is the specific achievement of Rohit Sharma regarding double centuries in ODIs?
output: Rohit Sharma is the only player in the world to have scored three double centuries in Men's ODI cricket.

instruction: Which Indian city is the home ground for Virat Kohli's primary IPL franchise?
output: Bengaluru (Royal Challengers Bengaluru).

instruction: Who was the coach of the Indian team when they won the 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup?
output: Gary Kirsten (South Africa) was the head coach.

instruction: Which Indian player scored the winning six in the 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup final?
output: MS Dhoni scored the winning six against Sri Lanka at Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai.

instruction: What major award did MS Dhoni receive from the Indian Government in 2018?
output: The Padma Bhushan, India's third-highest civilian award.

instruction: Which Indian player captained the team that shared the 2002 ICC Champions Trophy title?
output: Sourav Ganguly was the captain (the title was shared with Sri Lanka due to rain).

instruction: Who holds the record for the most dismissals (catches and stumpings) by a wicket-keeper for India in Test cricket?
output: MS Dhoni holds the record for the most dismissals by an Indian wicket-keeper in Tests.

instruction: Which Indian player has taken a hat-trick in the IPL?
output: Players like Amit Mishra, Yuvraj Singh, Rohit Sharma, and Harshal Patel have taken hat-tricks in the IPL.

instruction: What is the record for the highest opening partnership for India in Test cricket?
output: 413 runs, set by Vinoo Mankad and Pankaj Roy against New Zealand in Chennai in 1956.

instruction: Which Indian player took the most wickets in the 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup?
output: Zaheer Khan, who finished as the joint-highest wicket-taker (21 wickets) alongside Shahid Afridi.

instruction: Which Indian batsman was known as the 'Prince of Kolkata'?
output: Sourav Ganguly was famously known as the 'Prince of Kolkata' or 'Dada'.

instruction: What is Jasprit Bumrah's primary style of bowling action?
output: Jasprit Bumrah has an unusual, short, and slightly jerky run-up and delivery action, classified as a right-arm fast-medium bowler.

instruction: Who scored India's highest individual score in Test cricket?
output: Virender Sehwag, with 319 runs against South Africa in Chennai in 2008.

instruction: Which Indian bowler has the best bowling figures in an ODI match?
output: Stuart Binny, taking 6 wickets for 4 runs against Bangladesh in Mirpur in 2014.

instruction: What is the unique achievement of MS Dhoni being the only captain to win three major ICC trophies?
output: MS Dhoni is the only captain to have won the ICC World T20 (2007), the ICC Cricket World Cup (2011), and the ICC Champions Trophy (2013).

instruction: Which Indian cricketer was the first to take 400 Test wickets?
output: Kapil Dev, achieving the milestone in 1994.

instruction: Who holds the record for the fastest fifty by an Indian in T20 International cricket?
output: Yuvraj Singh, scoring a fifty off just 12 balls against England in the 2007 World T20.

instruction: Which Indian city hosts the Feroz Shah Kotla Ground, now renamed Arun Jaitley Stadium?
output: New Delhi hosts the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

instruction: What batting position is generally associated with Cheteshwar Pujara in Test cricket?
output: Cheteshwar Pujara is primarily known as India's reliable No. 3 batsman in Test cricket.

instruction: Who was the first Indian cricketer to be inducted into the ICC Cricket Hall of Fame?
output: Bishan Singh Bedi was among the inaugural inductees in 2009.

instruction: Which Indian stadium is known for its iconic bell that is rung to signal the start of play?
output: Eden Gardens in Kolkata features a bell, similar to the one at Lord's, that is rung by a cricket celebrity before play.

instruction: Who holds the record for the most sixes hit by an Indian in International cricket (all formats)?
output: Rohit Sharma holds the record for the most sixes hit by an Indian across all three international formats.
